text: The Portuguese Colonial War (Portuguese: Guerra Colonial Portuguesa) was fought between Portugal's military and the emerging nationalist movements in Portugal's African colonies between 1961 and 1974. Portugal fought the MPLA, FNLA, UNITA and FLEC in Angola between 1961 and 1974. Also, they fought the PAIGC in Guinea-Bissau between 1963 and 1974. Lastly, they fought the FRELIMO in Mozambique between 1964 and 1974. ==References== == Related pages == * Angolan War of Independence (1961–1974) * Guinea-Bissau War of Independence (1963–1974) * Mozambican War of Independence (1964–1974) * Angolan Civil War (1975–2002) * Mozambican Civil War (1977–1992) ==Other websites== * Guerra Colonial: 1961–1974 (guerracolonial.org) * Repression of Buddhism in Sri Lanka by the Portuguese (1505 - 1658) Category:20th century in Angola Category:Wars involving Portugal Category:Wars involving Africa Category:1960s conflicts Category:1970s conflicts
title: Portuguese Colonial War
